message:
What's the best book to learn algorithms for a web developer ? 
I kinda narrowed it down to three books (any other recommendations are welcome) :

1- Introduction to Algorithms, 3rd Edition
http://www.amazon.com/Introduction-Algorithms-3rd-Thomas-Cormen/dp/0262033844/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1422128070&sr=1-1&keywords=introduction+to+algorithmsm

2- The Algorithm Design Manual
http://www.amazon.com/Algorithm-Design-Manual-Steven-Skiena/dp/1848000693/ref=pd_sim_b_1?ie=UTF8&refRID=0WSWJSYNH2S8TFVTYTNP

3- Algorithms (4th Edition)
http://www.amazon.com/Algorithms-4th-Edition-Robert-Sedgewick/dp/032157351X/ref=pd_sim_b_5?ie=UTF8&refRID=0WSWJSYNH2S8TFVTYTNP

data.message: Robert Sedgewick's Princeton course is currently running on Coursera, highly recommended.
Kareem Kashwaa Yea, I'm aware of it. watched a couple of lectures. It's quite good, not rich in information like books thought
Although the Princeton nice combination (course+book), but the first book is the best in algorithms (in general)
